DataElement.preferredName: Cutaneous T-cell Lymphoma Response in Viscera Category
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Response category that describes the disease involvement in viscera based on staging and classification criteria for cutaneous T-cell lymphoma (CTCL).

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Primary Cutaneous T-Cell Non-Hodgkin Lymphoma Global Response in Viscera
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A T-cell non-Hodgkin lymphoma arising from the skin. Representative examples include mycosis fungoides and primary cutaneous anaplastic large cell lymphoma._Criteria for the response to treatment in viscera, as a component of global response.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A T-cell non-Hodgkin lymphoma arising from the skin. Representative examples include mycosis fungoides and primary cutaneous anaplastic large cell lymphoma.

Concepts.definition: A T-cell non-Hodgkin lymphoma arising from the skin. Representative examples include mycosis fungoides and primary cutaneous anaplastic large cell lymphoma.

Property.preferredDefinition: Criteria for the response to treatment in viscera, as a component of global response.

Concepts.definition: Criteria for the response to treatment in viscera, as a component of global response.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the response criteria (includes RECIST and others) and associated documentation of disease.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created for NCI-INC0370865: 19C0076 qns curation request. 4.17.19 mc

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Criteria for the response to treatment in viscera, as a component of global response._A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Liver or spleen or any organ considered involved at baseline should not be enlarged on physical exam and should be considered normal by imaging; no nodules should be present on imaging of liver or spleen; any post treatment mass must be determined by biopsy to be negative for lymphoma.

Concepts.definition: Liver or spleen or any organ considered involved at baseline should not be enlarged on physical exam and should be considered normal by imaging; no nodules should be present on imaging of liver or spleen; any post treatment mass must be determined by biopsy to be negative for lymphoma.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Greater than 50 percent increase in size by sum of products of diameter (SPD) of any organs involved at baseline; or new organ involvement or loss of response: greater than 50 percent increase from nadir in the size (SPD) of any previous organ involvement in those with partial response (whichever occurs first).

Concepts.definition: Greater than 50 percent increase in size by sum of products of diameter (SPD) of any organs involved at baseline; or new organ involvement or loss of response: greater than 50 percent increase from nadir in the size (SPD) of any previous organ involvement in those with partial response (whichever occurs first).

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: 50 percent or greater regression in any splenic or liver nodules, or in measurable disease (sum of products of diameter) in any organs abnormal at baseline; no increase in size of liver or spleen and no new sites of involvement.

Concepts.definition: 50 percent or greater regression in any splenic or liver nodules, or in measurable disease (sum of products of diameter) in any organs abnormal at baseline; no increase in size of liver or spleen and no new sites of involvement.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: New organ involvement in those with complete response.

Concepts.definition: New organ involvement in those with complete response.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Fails to attain the criteria for complete response, partial response, or progressive disease.

Concepts.definition: Fails to attain the criteria for complete response, partial response, or progressive disease.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the response criteria (includes RECIST and others) and associated documentation of disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Criteria for the response to treatment in viscera, as a component of global response.:A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.

Concepts.definition: Criteria for the response to treatment in viscera, as a component of global response.
A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.
